titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard McGee Morse Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Matthew T. MacLean

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:58

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence and subject files documenting the professional life of Richard McGee Morse, historian and educator, while at Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research, with the exception of the correspondence series, which is restricted until January 1, 2053.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard McGee Morse Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in four series: I. Correspondence, 1955-1985. II. Organizations, 1959-1972. III. Yale University, 1964-1977. IV. Subject Files, 1963-1984.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard McGee Morse received his B.A. from Princeton in 1943. He then studied at Columbia University, where he received his M.A. in 1947 and Ph.D. in 1952. Morse became associate professor of history at Yale University in 1962, and professor in 1963. He served as chairman of the Council on Latin American Studies in the 1963-1964 academic year. Morse was also a fellow of Silliman College until his departure from Yale in 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence and subject files documenting the professional life of Richard McGee Morse, historian and educator, while at Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is restricted until Jan 1, 2053.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged in alphabetical order by last name of the correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains materials related to various professional organizations with which Morse was involved. The series is arranged in alphabetical order by name of the organization.

did.unittitle: American Association of University Presses Latin American Translation Program
Committee on the International Exchange of Persons
Committee for the Study of Mankind
Hispanic American Historical Review Editorial Board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is divided into two sections: administration and teaching. The administration section contains materials related to the faculty committees and organizations Morse worked with while at Yale. The teaching section contains exams and syllabi from courses Morse taught.

did.unittitle: Board of Permanent Officers and Graduate School Faculty
Concilium on International and Area Studies
Council on Comparative and European Studies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged in alphabetical order by subject.
